strompris API¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: date = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API

Parameters:

date (datetime.date) –

Returns:

the dataframe with the collected data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

…

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: date = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ['NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5']) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame

Relies on LOCATION_CODES:

LOCATION_CODES = {

“NO1”: “Oslo”, “NO2”: “Kristiansand”, “NO3” : “Trondheim”, “NO4”: “Tromsø”, “NO5”: “Bergen” }

Method uses fetch_day_prices() to collect several dataframes of the desired days and locations and combines the data into a single pd.DataFrame that is returned.

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date) – the last date that you want to include data from, default = None

  • days (int) – number of days that you want to collect data from, default = 7

  • locations (list[str]) – list of keys to the LOCATION_CODES dict, default = list(LOCATION_CODES.keys())

Returns:

the dataframe of the collected data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

…

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot energy prices over time

x-axis should be time_start y-axis should be price in NOK each location should get its own line

Takes the dataframe from fetch prices and returns an altair chart

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – the dataframe from fetch_prices()

Returns:

the chart created from df

Return type:

alt.Chart
